labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to integrate with Productboard, a product management platform, offering tools to access and manage product data programmatically. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving product, feature, component, company, and note details, primarily serving users who need to interact with or automate Productboard's data. The tools provided are primarily read-only and centered around querying and retrieving structured information from Productboard.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Database Operations" was chosen because the tools primarily interact with Productboard's data structures to retrieve, filter, and organize information. The secondary label "Product Management" was chosen to reflect the server's specialized use case in product development workflows. No custom label is needed as the functionality fits well within existing categories, though "Productboard Integration" could be added for specificity if required by the system.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate the Productboard API into your workflows seamlessly. Access and manage product data efficiently to enhance your agentic capabilities. Streamline your processes with powerful tools designed for easy integration.

tools.name: get_features
tools.description: Returns a list of all features. This API is paginated and the page limit is always 100

tools.description: Returns detailed information about a specific feature

tools.name: get_components
tools.description: Returns a list of all components. This API is paginated and the page limit is always 100

tools.name: get_component_detail
tools.description: Returns detailed information about a specific component

tools.name: get_feature_statuses
tools.description: Returns a list of all feature statuses. This API is paginated and the page limit is always 100

tools.name: get_notes
tools.description: Returns a list of all notes

tools.name: get_note_detail

tools.name: get_company_detail

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kenjihikmatullah/productboard-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
